intro: Boechera serotina, commonly known as the late-fruiting rockcress, is a perennial herb native to North America. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard and cabbage plants. This plant is characterized by its basal leaves and small, white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in late summer. It typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils in open habitats. Boechera serotina is also notable for its ecological role in supporting pollinators and contributing to soil stability.
